The Annals of Baldurs Gate was a history book dedicated to the city of Baldurs Gate, published before 1492 DR.
This book was mass-printed and served as entertainment rather than scholarly work. The history of the Gate was penned with a certain bardic flair and filled with colorful exaggerations. The tomes preface, when it became commonly referred to as the village of Grey Harbour. The citys later namesake Balduran left the city poor but eventually sailed back, bearing riches. The books author claimed that Baldurans gold financed the settlements first harbor, invested in its businesses, and erected a wall. As per the books preface, Balduran became more famous than the village he was from, and with time it was renamed Baldurs Gate, leaving the citys previous names buried in maps and tomes of antiquity.
In the , a copy of this book was left in the Emerald Grove of the Western Heartlands.
